alert.note: Alert for Western Arctic Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 04 at 2:28PM AKST until February 06 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST MONDAY... * WHAT...Blowing snow with low visibility and wind chills to 65 below. East winds gusting to 40 mph. Visibility one quarter mile or less at times. * WHERE...Western Arctic Coast. * WHEN...Until 6 AM AKST Monday. * IMPACTS...Blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 65 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Blizzard conditions will continue at Point Lay through Sunday morning. Very cold wind chills will continue in all areas through Monday morning. The strongest winds and worst conditions are from Point Lay south. Wind and blowing snow are less extreme north of Point Lay.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning for blowing snow means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. This will make travel very difficult or impossible.
